metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: PHP Casting
Sometimes you need to change a variable from one data type into another, and sometimes you want a variable to have a specific data type. This can be done with casting.
content.html: Sometimes you need to change a variable from one data type into another, and sometimes you want a variable to have a specific data type. This can be done with casting.

content.text: Change Data Type
Casting in PHP is done with these statements:
content.html: Casting in PHP is done with these statements:

content.text: Cast to String
To cast to string, use the (string) statement:
content.html: To cast to string, use the (string) statement:

content.code_html:
$a = 5;       // Integer
$b = 5.34;    // Float
$c = "hello"; // String
$d = true;    // Boolean
$e = NULL;    // NULL

$a = (string) $a;
$b = (string) $b;
$c = (string) $c;
$d = (string) $d;
$e = (string) $e;

//To verify the type of any object in PHP, use the var_dump() function:
var_dump($a);
var_dump($b);
var_dump($c);
var_dump($d);
var_dump($e);

content.text: Cast to Integer
To cast to integer, use the (int) statement:
content.html: To cast to integer, use the (int) statement:

content.code_html:
$a = 5;       // Integer
$b = 5.34;    // Float
$c = "25 kilometers"; // String
$d = "kilometers 25"; // String
$e = "hello"; // String
$f = true;    // Boolean
$g = NULL;    // NULL

$a = (int) $a;
$b = (int) $b;
$c = (int) $c;
$d = (int) $d;
$e = (int) $e;
$f = (int) $f;
$g = (int) $g;

content.text: Cast to Float
To cast to float, use the (float) statement:
content.html: To cast to float, use the (float) statement:

content.code_html:
$a = 5;       // Integer
$b = 5.34;    // Float
$c = "25 kilometers"; // String
$d = "kilometers 25"; // String
$e = "hello"; // String
$f = true;    // Boolean
$g = NULL;    // NULL

$a = (float) $a;
$b = (float) $b;
$c = (float) $c;
$d = (float) $d;
$e = (float) $e;
$f = (float) $f;
$g = (float) $g;

content.text: Cast to Boolean
To cast to boolean, use the (bool) statement:
content.html: To cast to boolean, use the (bool) statement:

content.code_html:
$a = 5;       // Integer
$b = 5.34;    // Float
$c = 0;       // Integer
$d = -1;      // Integer
$e = 0.1;     // Float
$f = "hello"; // String
$g = "";      // String
$h = true;    // Boolean
$i = NULL;    // NULL

$a = (bool) $a;
$b = (bool) $b;
$c = (bool) $c;
$d = (bool) $d;
$e = (bool) $e;
$f = (bool) $f;
$g = (bool) $g;
$h = (bool) $h;
$i = (bool) $i;

content.text: If a value is 0, NULL, false, or empty, the (bool) converts it into false, otherwise true.
content.html: If a value is 0, NULL, false, or empty, the (bool) converts it into false, otherwise true.

content.text: Even -1 converts to true.
content.html: Even -1 converts to true.

content.text: Cast to Array
To cast to array, use the (array) statement:
content.html: To cast to array, use the (array) statement:

content.code_html:
$a = 5;       // Integer
$b = 5.34;    // Float
$c = "hello"; // String
$d = true;    // Boolean
$e = NULL;    // NULL

$a = (array) $a;
$b = (array) $b;
$c = (array) $c;
$d = (array) $d;
$e = (array) $e;

content.text: When converting into arrays, most data types converts into an indexed array with one element.
content.html: When converting into arrays, most data types converts into an indexed array with one element.

content.text: NULL values converts to an empty array object.
content.html: NULL values converts to an empty array object.

content.text: Objects converts into associative arrays where the property names becomes the keys and the property values becomes the values:
content.html: Objects converts into associative arrays where the property names becomes the keys and the property values becomes the values:

content.code:
class

Car

{


public

$color
;


public

$model
;


public

function

__construct
(
$color
,

$model
)

{


$this
->
color

=

$color
;


$this
->
model

=

$model
;


}


public

function

message
(
)

{


return

"My car is a "

.

$this
->
color

.

" "

.

$this
->
model

.

"!"
;


}


}



$myCar

=

new

Car
(
"red"
,

"Volvo"
)
;



$myCar

=

(
array
)

$myCar
;


var_dump
(
$myCar
)
;
content.code_html:
class Car {
  public $color;
  public $model;
  public function __construct($color, $model) {
    $this->color = $color;
    $this->model = $model;
  }
  public function message() {
    return "My car is a " . $this->color . " " . $this->model . "!";
  }
}

$myCar = new Car("red", "Volvo");

$myCar = (array) $myCar;
var_dump($myCar);

content.text: Cast to Object
To cast to object, use the (object) statement:
content.html: To cast to object, use the (object) statement:

content.code_html:
$a = 5;       // Integer
$b = 5.34;    // Float
$c = "hello"; // String
$d = true;    // Boolean
$e = NULL;    // NULL

$a = (object) $a;
$b = (object) $b;
$c = (object) $c;
$d = (object) $d;
$e = (object) $e;

content.text: When converting into objects, most data types converts into a object with one property, named "scalar", with the corresponding value.
content.html: When converting into objects, most data types converts into a object with one property, named "scalar", with the corresponding value.

content.text: NULL values converts to an empty object.
content.html: NULL values converts to an empty object.

content.text: Indexed arrays converts into objects with the index number as property name and the value as property value.
content.html: Indexed arrays converts into objects with the index number as property name and the value as property value.

content.text: Associative arrays converts into objects with the keys as property names and values as property values.
content.html: Associative arrays converts into objects with the keys as property names and values as property values.

content.code:
$a

=

array
(
"Volvo"
,

"BMW"
,

"Toyota"
)
;

// indexed array


$b

=

array
(
"Peter"
=>
"35"
,

"Ben"
=>
"37"
,

"Joe"
=>
"43"
)
;

// associative array



$a

=

(
object
)

$a
;


$b

=

(
object
)

$b
;
content.code_html:
$a = array("Volvo", "BMW", "Toyota"); // indexed array
$b = array("Peter"=>"35", "Ben"=>"37", "Joe"=>"43"); // associative array

$a = (object) $a;
$b = (object) $b;

content.text: Cast to NULL
To cast to NULL, use the (unset) statement:
content.html: To cast to NULL, use the (unset) statement:

content.code_html:
$a = 5;       // Integer
$b = 5.34;    // Float
$c = "hello"; // String
$d = true;    // Boolean
$e = NULL;    // NULL

$a = (unset) $a;
$b = (unset) $b;
$c = (unset) $c;
$d = (unset) $d;
$e = (unset) $e;
